![Resolve Branch Conflicts](https://cdn.sanity.io/images/36fprbnn/production/1f28d91f7bb85f67cb25b10289607fcf9c611458-1478x892.png?w=2000&fit=max&auto=format)

You should be in the branch you are currently modifying (not `master`) and first merge `master` into this branch: under source control, click the three dots and select in the menu `Branch` -> `Merge Branch` (see screenshot) and select `Master`. It will say you now have conflicts that you need to resolve manually, and then you should be clear to go.

title: Kubernetes Ingress with Let’s Encrypt using Cert-Manager

body.raw:
## Install cert-manager

```bash
kubectl apply -f https://github.com/jetstack/cert-manager/releases/download/v1.11.0/cert-manager.crds.yaml
```

```bash
helm repo add jetstack https://charts.jetstack.io
```

```bash
helm repo update
```

```bash
helm install \
    cert-manager jetstack/cert-manager \
    --namespace cert-manager \
    --create-namespace \
    --version v1.11.0
```

```bash
kubectl get pods --namespace cert-manager
```

## Create issuer

```bash
cat <<EOF > staging-issuer.yaml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: letsencrypt-staging
spec:
  acme:
    server: https://acme-staging-v02.api.letsencrypt.org/directory
    email: you@youremail.com
    privateKeySecretRef:
      name: letsencrypt-staging
    solvers:
    - http01:
        ingress:
          class: nginx
EOF
```

```bash
kubectl apply -f staging-issuer.yaml
```

```bash
kubectl describe clusterissuer letsencrypt-staging
```

## Deploy a TLS Ingress Resource

```yaml
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: ingress-demo
  annotations:
    cert-manager.io/issuer: "letsencrypt-staging" # Replace this with a production issuer once you've tested it
    acme.cert-manager.io/http01-edit-in-place: "true"
    [..]
spec:
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - ingress-demo.example.com
      secretName: ingress-demo-cert-secret
    [...]
```

## Verify

```bash
kubectl get certificate
```

```bash
kubectl describe certificate ingress-demo-cert-secret
```

```bash
kubectl describe secret ingress-demo-cert-secret
```

## Switch to Let’s Encrypt Production

```bash
cat <<EOF > production-issuer.yaml
apiVersion: cert-manager.io/v1
kind: ClusterIssuer
metadata:
  name: letsencrypt-prod
spec:
  acme:
    server: https://acme-v02.api.letsencrypt.org/directory
    email: you@youremail.com
    privateKeySecretRef:
      name: letsencrypt-prod
    solvers:
    - http01:
        ingress:
          class: nginx
EOF
```

```bash
kubectl apply -f production-issuer.yaml
```

```yaml
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: ingress-demo
  annotations:
    cert-manager.io/issuer: "letsencrypt-prod"
    acme.cert-manager.io/http01-edit-in-place: "true"
    [..]
spec:
  tls:
    - hosts:
        - ingress-demo.example.com
      secretName: ingress-demo-cert-secret
    [...]
```
